title: How to Make Butternut Squash and Sweet Potato Soup

steps.headline: Cut open the butternut squash and scoop out the seeds and stringy stuff.
steps.description: You can roast the seeds, discard them, or compost them if you want to try growing squash next year.

steps.headline: Steam the squash in an inch or so (a few centimeters) of water, until tender.
steps.description:
You can proceed with cutting up the rest of the ingredients while it steams. Set it aside to cool. steps.headline: Chop the vegetables into chunks, while the squash steams.
Sauté the onions and the celery in the pot where you will make the soup.
Add the soup cubes and water or stock to cover.
steps.description: Bring the mixture to a simmer.

steps.headline: Scoop the squash out of the peels and add to the mixture.
Add garam masala and ginger.
steps.description: For a whole butternut squash, start with a tablespoon of garam masala and half a teaspoon of ginger. Adjust to taste.

steps.headline: Simmer, covered, until sweet potatoes and carrots are cooked tender.
Use a potato masher, blender, or immersion blender to break up large chunks.
Serve.
steps.description: This soup goes well with rustic, crusty bread for a wholesome meal.

text:
Cut open the butternut squash and scoop out the seeds and stringy stuff. You can roast the seeds, discard them, or compost them if you want to try growing squash next year. Steam the squash in an inch or so (a few centimeters) of water, until tender. You can proceed with cutting up the rest of the ingredients while it steams. Set it aside to cool. Test the squash with a fork or pick. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/35\/Butternut_2a_408.jpg\/460px-Butternut_2a_408.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/35\/Butternut_2a_408.jpg\/759px-Butternut_2a_408.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":323,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":533.4615384615385,"licensing":"

butternut soup, by Dvortygirl, December 2012\n<\/p>

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Set it aside to cool, when done. Chop the vegetables into chunks, while the squash steams. Sauté the onions and the celery in the pot where you will make the soup. Add carrots and sweet potatoes. Add the soup cubes and water or stock to cover. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Scoop the squash out of the peels and add to the mixture. Compost or discard the peels. Add garam masala and ginger. For a whole butternut squash, start with a tablespoon of garam masala and half a teaspoon of ginger. Adjust to taste. Simmer, covered, until sweet potatoes and carrots are cooked tender. Stir occasionally. Use a potato masher, blender, or immersion blender to break up large chunks. Smaller chunks don't matter. Serve. This soup goes well with rustic, crusty bread for a wholesome meal.
